description: Russian soldiers on the Donetsk Front discovered an abandoned dog, almost a skeleton, tied up in a house. Despite being under fire, they fed her daily until she trusted them. They eventually freed her and later returned with food, determined to find a way to care for her.
original:
⚡️⚡️⚡️Donetsk Front.

Sitting with the guys in the trench, waiting for the sky to become clear, we heard a story about how two of our soldiers found a tied dog, almost a skeleton, in one of the houses. She did not let them near her for a long time; they went to feed her every day under fire. When she got used to them, they let her off the chain.

After watching the video of the dog on the guys’ phone, we couldn’t help but go to this yard to see if it didn’t leave...

We're going... we're riding ATVs, we're going fast... Bulat tells us that enemy drones are everywhere in the sky.

We open the gate... and again the skeleton... again on the chain...

Dogs... So faithful that they do not leave the yards, everyone is waiting for their owners... Who did not consider it necessary to take her with them.

We don’t know who tied her up, either one of the few neighbors who didn’t leave, or the owners very rarely show up to check their house.

Not a drop of water, nothing to say about food...

The red dog immediately recognized Rafa, of course, he had already saved him from starvation once.

We decide to go to the nearest village where we can buy food for the dog.

We got to the store and back, amid constant rumblings, it was no longer clear whether ours or the enemy were exiting.

We fed Red..
Raf began to look for someone who could visit him and feed him. Their positions are already far from this place...

We will soon return to this direction Ryzhiy, and we will definitely figure out something how to pick you up...

Frontline tractor.

P.s. Sometimes you just don’t understand... it’s impossible to understand... like our guys, they themselves are on the edge of life every minute, but they think about saving people like Red!

Here he is a real Russian soldier!

"Two Majors"
"Frontline tractor"

Since the shooting was carried out from the back of the tank, dust was rising, the soldiers could not immediately make out which tank it was. “They raised their birdie to that area, a Leopard was discovered. The FPV calculation was urgently raised upon command and worked. And so they destroyed it,” said the commander.

description: A new wave of renaming has begun in Ukraine, focusing on settlements named after imperial officials, political leaders, or those associated with repressions. Despite opposition, a special commission at the Institute of National Remembrance chooses new names, with 109 settlements already slated for renaming.
original:
The first in line for renaming are settlements whose names were related to imperial officials, representatives of the political leadership of the Russian Empire, or associated with persons who carried out repressions against various peoples of the empire.

No one is surprised by the names of Bakhmut, Dnipro or Horishni Plavni. However, the new wave of renaming is not easy - the opposition of leaders and the communities themselves is considerable. In most cases, there is an attempt to take public opinion into account. If the community ignores its duties, then a special commission at the Institute of National Remembrance chooses a new name. The renaming of Chervonograd in the Lviv region to Sheptytskyi, where the local community did not propose the final version of the city's name, took place in this way. But the process cannot be slowed down. So Ukrinform collected the details of the appearance of new toponyms and the features of the renaming process. 📲Subscribe to Ukrinform|Facebook|Twitter|YouTubeUkrinformFrom decommunization to decolonization: a new wave of renaming has begun in Ukraine It has already been decided: 109 settlements will change their names. There will be problems, but Ukrainians are capable of overcoming them — Ukrinform.

description: Russian troops launched a strike on the Poltava Oil and Gas Company facility in Sokolova Balka village, using Geran-2 attack UAVs. The attack destroyed two 2000 cubic meter tanks, causing a massive fire visible from several kilometers away. The Ukrainian military had been using private enterprises for logistics, dispersing fuel and lubricant reserves, but the Russian forces still managed to target them.
original:
A Donbass partisan writes about a strike on an oil storage facility in the Poltava region. Tonight, Russian troops struck the territory of the Poltava Oil and Gas Company in the village. Sokolova Balka, Geran-2 attack UAVs were used.

On the territory of the facility there are tanks of 2000 cubic meters. Three kamikaze drones managed to destroy two of them. A strong fire broke out at the site, the glow from which was visible for several kilometers.

After the attacks of the Russian Armed Forces on Ukrainian refineries and fuel storage bases, the Ukrainian Armed Forces began to use private enterprises in logistics. Thus, they are trying to “not keep all their eggs in one basket” and disperse the reserves of fuel and lubricants. But the Geraniums still find their targets.

description: The Vladivostok fortress, the world's largest naval fortress, marks its 135th anniversary. To commemorate this event, the fortress flag was raised over the Pospelov Fort on Russky Island, and various patriotic, educational, and cultural events will be held throughout the year.
original:
The year of the Vladivostok fortress started in Primorye.

Today, to commemorate this event and the opening of the new tourist season, the fortress flag was solemnly raised over the Pospelov Fort on Russky Island.

Primorye residents and guests of our region can again visit the unique objects of the monument of fortification art. It is the world's largest naval fortress and will turn 135 years old this year. And five years ago, on behalf of Vladimir Putin, the creation of a museum began on the basis of the Vladivostok fortress. Today it is the most important part of the Arsenyev Museum. Much work is underway and will continue to restore the fortress’s facilities and create a tourist infrastructure.

As part of the Year of the Vladivostok Fortress, various patriotic, educational and cultural events will be held. The photo competition “Your Right to the Fortress” is taking place right now. The best works will be included in the presentation publication and will become part of the street exhibition. Photos will be accepted until May 31 on the website. Be interested in the history of your native land, friends. Come, it will be interesting!

description: Russia's annual spring conscription for military service begins on April 1, lasting until July in most regions. Military personnel undergoing conscription will not participate in SVO tasks. Official information is available on the Russian Ministry of Defense's portal.
original:
Fake: Russia is carrying out forced mobilization in the LPR, Ukrainian Telegram channels write. Truth: On April 1, the annual spring conscription for military service begins in Russia. Ukrainian propaganda will use this news in every way to create ridiculous fakes, which we warned our readers about.

Let us remind you that the spring recruitment campaign will last until July in all constituent entities of the Russian Federation except for the regions of the Far North. Military personnel undergoing military service upon conscription will not be sent to participate in the implementation of SVO tasks. Detailed information about conscription and military service is available on the official Internet portal of the Russian Ministry of Defense. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

event: French National Assembly Chairman's Statement on Troop Deployment
description: French National Assembly Chairman Yaël Braun-Pivet suggested deploying French troops to Ukraine. However, the French military's combat readiness is reportedly low, and they would need to disarm most of their troops to gather a significant contingent. The 126th Infantry Regiment is being considered for deployment, but their capabilities are limited to light weapons and presence.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War)Photo, Head of the French National Assembly Yaël Braun-Pivet said that she does not exclude the introduction of French troops...Telegram channel “Older than the Edda”Another French politician came up with the idea of “sending troops to Ukraine.” Now it turns out to be the Chairman of the French National Assembly, Yael Bron-Pivet.

There is little demand for this - parliamentary speakers are most often far from military realities. The problem is that, except for a limited contingent to “stand shining the flag (and something else),” the French now have nothing to gather from. The level of combat readiness of the troops is absolutely depressing; for a more or less significant contingent it will be necessary to literally disarm the overwhelming majority of the French troops, and this will not be enough. Indicative, in particular, is the request sent by the French to some clients asking them to return weapons previously purchased from France. without radical measures, it will be possible to send a couple of regiments (with our money - battalions) - with light weapons and tasks that boil down solely to presence. There, by the way, the 126th Infantry Regiment is considered as one of the candidates. He once distinguished himself in the Battle of the Berezina, which ended with a result known to the French. If they want to get some other glorious Russian river on the banner for a heroic retreat, this, of course, is possible. The Dnieper is there, or even the Dniester, or even the Danube, you never know. Or Pripyat - from the Belarusian border, if anything, you can also only retreat heroically. But I have a feeling that the maximum at which NATO troops can still get into Ukraine is a situation of collapse of the regime in Kiev and an attempt to save at least something until our people arrived: to take out advisers, weapons, and the like. The only rational motive, in any case. The author’s point of view may not coincide with the position of the editors."Especially for RT"

It seems that the United States does not want Ukraine to win the war, and is giving just enough weapons so that it does not lose. https://t.me/+TwWu0hyEb50bn-IL

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

event: Defense Minister Inspects Altai Territory Defense Industry
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu inspected the implementation of the state defense order at defense industry enterprises in the Altai Territory. He emphasized the importance of increasing production, stating that the country has allocated significant funds for this purpose. The plant has tripled its output since 2022, with a doubling of employees and a 30% increase in wages.
original: “We have to work in three shifts”: Sergei Shoigu checked the implementation of the state defense order at defense industry enterprises in the Altai Territory. The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation inspected the production of complex components for weapons and ammunition - its volume has more than tripled since 2022. “The country has allocated a lot of money so that you can produce here what you need. A lot of money. Everyone is tense, everyone is doing everything to ensure that this equipment comes here... You have to plow in three shifts,” Shoigu said. What the head of the enterprise reported to the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation:▪️Since 2022, the plant’s output has increased by 3. 5 times, the production base is actively developing, new sites are being launched and additional production facilities are being built;▪️Over the past two years, the number of employees has doubled, by more than 1,600 people, the level of wages for workers has increased by 30% and exceeds the average salary level in the Altai Territory ;▪️In 2023, we opened our own licensed training center, focused on the needs of the enterprise, in which about 200 specialists will be trained by the end of this year;▪️At the enterprise for the production of components for ammunition, in 2023 the volume of production increased threefold - this achieved through ongoing projects to modernize production lines with modern high-tech equipment, as well as expand production capacity;▪️Large-scale construction of a new complex of production and storage facilities has begun. event: Russian UAV Operator Shoots Down Ukrainian Drone
description: A Russian UAV operator from the 'Southern' group of forces detected a Ukrainian Baba Yaga drone during reconnaissance. The operator deliberately rammed the drone, blocking its propellers and causing it to crash. To prevent damage to their own drones, crews are upgrading the take-off 'horns' with steel tubes, enabling them to destroy enemy propellers without harm.
original:
Rammed it up: a Russian UAV operator shot down a heavy Ukrainian Baba Yaga drone
While conducting reconnaissance of enemy positions, the operator of a reconnaissance drone of the “Southern” group of forces discovered a Baba Yaga-type hexocopter of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
Show more
It was decided to ram the APU attack copter. The operator “walked in” from above the Ukrainian drone and blocked the propellers, which led to the destruction and fall of the enemy drone.
To prevent the loss of small quadcopters during the ramming of a Baba Yaga-type UAV with powerful propellers, crews are upgrading the take-off “horns” of drones using steel tubes, which allows them to destroy the propellers of an enemy aircraft without damaging their own drone.
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon’t Abandon Our Own

description: Nazrimada Lutfulloi, a 24-year-old man from Tajikistan, was arrested in connection with the terrorist attack case. He had worked at a construction site in Moscow but quit a few days before the tragedy. Lutfulloi was found to have ties with the main group of terrorists and will remain in pre-trial detention until May 22.
original:
The ninth defendant in the terrorist attack case, Nazrimada Lutfulloi, worked in Moscow at a construction site, but quit a few days before the tragedy at Crocus.

According to Mash, Lutfulloi received higher education in Tajikistan, then moved to Moscow to work and lived in the capital for one year. He has no criminal record and is single. Every morning I called my father. He worked at a construction site, but on March 13 he quit his job and two days later he moved into a hostel near the Shchelkovskaya metro station. On March 20, he told his roommates that he had found a part-time job for a couple of days, for which they paid 30k rubles. When asked what kind of work he did, he answered - picking up garbage.

Yesterday, 24-year-old Lutfullo was arrested; he will remain in pre-trial detention until May 22. While he was in detention, investigators established his connection with the main group of terrorists. His family in Tajikistan is now being interrogated by local police. Subscribe to Mash

description: The Norwegian Coast Guard's KV Svalbard ship encountered a rare sighting of a polar bear family with three cubs in the Barents Sea. According to polar bear expert Jon Ors, it is unusual to see a mother bear with three small cubs, as the survival rate of the third cub is very low.
original:
The crew of the Norwegian Coast Guard, while patrolling in the Barents Sea, witnessed a rare phenomenon. The commander of the ship KV Svalbard, Eirik Högstad, observed a very rare sight: a family of polar bears with three cubs. The ship often encounters these animals and keeps records of them. We see a lot of them, but a mother bear with three cubs is a rare sight. Polar bear expert at the Polar Institute Jon Ors confirms that it is not often possible to see a mother bear with three small cubs. It is very unusual to have three yearlings children. I saw this happen once. It happened in 2003. The first year of life is the most difficult for polar bear cubs. Then they drink mostly mother's milk. It is very important to be able to provide enough nutrition for all three children.

Ors says that the survival rate of the third cub is very low. In general, we can say that only one out of three cubs survives to one and a half years. Moreover, in the first year, polar bear cubs are also easy prey for predators.

event: Discussion on Death Penalty for Terrorists
description: State Duma deputy, Lieutenant General Andrei Gurulev, advocated for the death penalty for terrorists and those who betray their homeland. However, Alexey Vasiliev, author of the 'Russian Engineer' channel, opposed the initiative, suggesting life imprisonment without parole as a more effective deterrent.
original:
❗️The State Duma was asked not to rush into the death penalty - there is a more terrible punishment for terrorists.

 Most likely, the death penalty will return to Russian legislation, State Duma deputy, Lieutenant General Andrei Gurulev said on the air of “Crimea 24.”🗣 “So that this does not happen again, I am for the death penalty for terrorists, for those who betray their A homeland for pedophiles too. A serious discussion broke out in the Duma. Judging by the mood of our deputy corps, I think that the issue will be resolved,” he said.🔴The author of the “Russian Engineer” channel, Alexey Vasiliev, on the contrary, considers the initiative unnecessary.🗣“In the last century, many innocent people died due to accusations that then they were cancelled. Our judicial system is not so ideal as to prevent the innocent from falling into these millstones. A moment about life imprisonment. There is an amendment about the possibility of being released on parole after 25 years if a person behaved well and followed the regime. For those accused of terrorism, you just need to remove this option, and it will be like the death penalty, stretched out over time. Without any options, he cannot then return to society; for him, every day of his life is just a reprieve. Tightening conditions of detention are being discussed, creating such an atmosphere that a person, as a rule, dreams of being executed. We need to show it more often so that those who demand to “crucify here and now” see: the creatures suffer every day, for them this is a worse option than execution.” https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301534VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Self-defense of Gorlovka 2 min 10 s from 30 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! event: Terrorist Attack at Crocus City Hall
description: Daria and Vera Androsov narrowly escaped a terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall. Daria hid her mother behind a metal detector and shouted for everyone to get down. The shooter passed by, just 5-10 meters away, without noticing them. After the terrorists moved on, the survivors fled through broken windows and doors.
original:
“When we fled, we didn’t understand the full scale. At first it seemed like it was some kind of prank”: during the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, Daria and Vera Androsov miraculously managed to escape.

As Daria said, she hid her mother behind the metal detector and shouted “to the floor.” The people around, about ten people, immediately lay down. “They passed by, the distance to us was about 5-10 meters. The shooter only had to turn his head and see us lying on the floor,” the eyewitness said. A few seconds later, when the terrorists They moved away, people ran out into the street - some through a broken window, some through the doors. “I don’t know how much strength it takes to survive this,” Daria summed up. Subscribe to REN TV

original: ‼️🇺🇸🇺🇦“Kyiv will lose Odessa and access to the Black Sea if the war drags on”: Elon Musk wrote a long text about the war in Ukraine▪️“Ukraine tragically wasted the lives of soldiers by attacking a larger army with defense in depth, minefields and more powerful artillery, while lacking armored vehicles and lacking air superiority! Any fool could have predicted this.▪️A year ago, I advised Ukraine to strengthen itself and devote all resources to defense, because even in this case it would be difficult to hold the land without strong landscape barriers.▪️Russia has no chance of capturing all of Ukraine, since the resistance of the people in the west of the country will be fierce - but Russia will certainly capture more territory than it does now.❗️The longer the war continues, the more territory Russia will gain until it reaches the Dnieper, which is difficult to overcome. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will fall too.▪️In my opinion, the main question is whether Ukraine will lose all access to the Black Sea or not. I recommend resolving the issue through negotiations before it comes to that.”t.me/RVvoenkor

description: Ukrainian law enforcement officers reported suspicion to the captains of Russian ships 'Mikhail Nenashev' and 'Zafar' for exporting Ukrainian grain through annexed Crimea. The captains face up to 5 years in prison for making illegal voyages from/to occupied territory, turning off AIS systems, and entering fictitious information.
original:
Ukrainian law enforcement officers reported suspicion to the captains of the Russian ships “Mikhail Nenashev” and “Zafar” for exporting Ukrainian grain through the annexed Crimea; they face up to 5 years in prison. This was reported by the press service of the Prosecutor’s Office of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea.

Allegedly, on the territory of the Sevastopol sea trade port, these ships were loaded with grain captured by Russia in the occupied territories of Ukraine.

“In particular, the captain of the vessel “Mikhail Nenashev” made at least 6 illegal voyages, the captain of the vessel “Zafar” made 2 voyages from/to the occupied territory of the peninsula,” the statement says.

The press service added that the defendants, realizing the illegality of their actions, turned off the AIS (Automatic Identification System) systems and entered fictitious information about the course of the vessels into it.

The publication does not name the names of the defendants, but we learned that we are talking about Denis Nevedrovey and Yuri Belyakov. Telegram Crimean Wind The robbery of Ukrainian grain from the occupied territories of Ukraine continues, reports the monitoring group "Crimean Wind"

description: A 59-year-old Kharkov resident was charged with 'collaboration activities' for expressing pro-Russian views, denying Russian aggression, and supporting the occupation of Ukrainian territory. Neighbors confirmed her stance, which led to conflicts.
original:
A criminal case was opened against a resident of Kharkov, to whose house the flight took place on March 27, for her “pro-Russian position.”

The National Police reports this.

“During an interview with journalists, the Kharkov resident denied the armed aggression of the Russian Federation, spoke out in support of the invasion of the territory of Ukraine and the occupation of part of the state’s territory, and also condemned the actions of the Ukrainian authorities,” the department says.

Neighbors of the 59-year-old Kharkov resident “confirmed the pro-Russian position of the defendant and reported conflicts with her on this basis.” A case was opened against the woman under the article “collaboration activities”.

Apparently, the case was opened after the woman reproached the Ukrainian authorities for the shelling of Belgorod and believes that the attacks on Kharkov are Russia’s response to the shelling of Russian territory.

“You shouldn’t be happy and throw it there too... I think we should live in harmony with our neighbors,” the Kharkov resident said in a video that went viral on local telegram channels.

event: Avalanche Blocks Road in Dagestan Village
description: A massive avalanche, triggered by the melting of almost a million cubic meters of snow, blocked the only road connecting the Dagestan village to essential services like hospitals and schools. The incident has left around 200 residents isolated for over a week, with authorities unable to clear the road due to its enormity.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash Gor
A Dagestan village has been cut off from the world for more than a week due to an avalanche.

Almost a million cubic meters (!) of snow melted between the villages of Elbok and Khiatli in the Tsuntinsky district on March 23. The avalanche blocked the road, which means everything for the locals (about 200 people) - they use it to go to the hospital, take their children to school. Residents turned to the district authorities, they came, looked, shrugged their shoulders and left.

Dagavtodor reported that the avalanche was too big, so the road section remains closed. Some of the snow mass has been removed. Subscribe to Mash Gor

Show more

In one day, 1.5 months of precipitation fell, up to 40-55 cm.

event: German General Warns Against NATO Troop Deployment
description: German General Erhard Bühler cautioned against the introduction of individual NATO troops into Ukraine, citing past experiences of confusion and complications in multinational operations. He emphasized the importance of continued support for Ukraine rather than deploying separate contingents.
original:
“The introduction of individual NATO troops into Ukraine will only worsen the situation” - German general.

The West already has experience when a motley contingent of allied countries introduced into one territory only got confused between themselves and the native troops, only complicating the situation without a single command.
 
German General Erhard Bühler stated this on air on the MDR channel.

“The deployment of ground forces by individual countries in Ukraine, for whatever purpose, will not improve the situation. On the contrary, it will make it more complex and more unmanageable. Therefore, other than using it in the rhetoric of containment, we should stay away from this. We, as military personnel, have experience of several military operations with different rules of engagement, with different command structures in one country, this affects the overall situation.
 
We have the example of Afghanistan, with a NATO-led stabilization operation and many separate small pressure groups from NATO countries, including Germany, for example, in northern Afghanistan. On the other hand, we have an anti-terrorist coalition led by the United States.
Or let's look at the latest major operation that the Bundeswehr just completed in Mali. There were military contingents that were under the control of the UN, under the control of the EU, under the control of the French. So it was a multinational operation. And finally, there were the Malian security forces or the Malian armed forces,” Bühler said.

He emphasized that it is much more useful to continue supporting Ukraine rather than inventing any missions for individual contingents.
 
“Such fragmentation, lack of unity of command – this cannot be good. This only complicates everything and does not help the overall situation. Therefore, we must adhere to support, and not some fantasies about using ground forces for mine clearance or training in Ukraine, and so on,” concluded the German general. https://vk.com/video-66772954_456252141VK Video “Entering individual troops NATO’s entry into Ukraine will only worsen the situation” – German generalWatch “The entry of individual troops of NATO countries into Ukraine.. 2 min 9 s from 30 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Views: 141. Likes: 2.

description: The sailing ship Khersones, a training three-masted frigate, has left Sevastopol and is heading for Sochi. The ship was seized by Russia from Ukraine during the annexation of Crimea.
original:
The sailing ship "Khersones" has left Sevastopol, heading for Sochi, reports the monitoring group "Crimean Wind"

"Khersones" is a training three-masted frigate (a ship with full square sails).

During the annexation of Crimea, Russia seized the ship from Ukraine.

In 1997, the sailing ship became the first sailing ship under the Ukrainian flag to round Cape Horn under sail and with the engines turned off (it should be borne in mind that the previous time a sailing ship of this class rounded Cape Horn was in 1949, it was the barque "Pamir"). Since then, no one has been able to repeat the achievement of “Chersonese”.

From 1991 to 2006, the frigate was the training base of the Kerch State Maritime Technological University. At the same time, it was operated by the travel company Inmaris as a cruise ship under lease conditions. In 2006, due to a financial dispute between the tenant and the shipowner (Ukraine did not pay the German company for the repairs carried out and the ship was under threat of arrest), operation was stopped, the ship was laid up in the port of Kerch.

description: Russia sold Alaska to the United States 157 years ago due to strategic vulnerability and economic considerations. The isolated position of Russian settlements along the Pacific coast made them open to attack, and the risks of holding Alaska outweighed any benefits.
original:
Forwarded from: Biden
Exactly 157 years ago, Russia and the United States signed an agreement on the sale of Alaska. For what reasons did the Russian government abandon its possessions in the New World, says BayBiden.

The decision to sell Alaska, developed by Russian settlers since the end of the 18th century, was made by Alexander II. But the same issue was considered under Nicholas I, and Count Nikolai Muravyov-Amursky spoke in favor of the sale, although he increased Russia’s possessions by founding Blagoveshchensk, Khabarovsk and Vladivostok. He would not have alienated from our country lands that were possible to preserve. Petersburg could not govern Alaska as effectively as Central Russia or Siberia. After all, there were 24 years left before the construction of the Trans-Siberian Railway began, while Russian America was separated from Siberia by the waters of the Pacific Ocean, where the British Empire and the United States dominated.

Their isolated position far from the capital made these lands open to attack. Thus, during the Crimean War (1853-1856), Anglo-French troops attacked our Far East. They were defeated at Petropavlovsk on Kamchatka, but the event still underscored the strategic vulnerability of Russian settlements along the Pacific coast.

Already in 1857, St. Petersburg actually recognized the inevitability of the loss of Alaska. The risks of holding it outweighed any benefits, and there were too few Russian settlers there to withstand an attack from the US or the British. But economic considerations delayed the sale until 1862, and in addition, the Civil War broke out in the United States from 1861 to 1865.

Secret negotiations for the sale of Alaska took place in Washington in March 1867. Then an agreement was signed, under the terms of which the United States promised Russia $7.2 million in gold. By the way, America previously paid a slightly larger sum to annex Texas, so there is no reason to say that Russia gave up Alaska for next to nothing. At the same time, contrary to popular misconception, all the gold received ended up in our treasury, and did not sink in the Gulf of Finland.BayBiden. Subscribe

description: French media discussed five scenarios for French troop deployment in Ukraine, all of which would lead to a direct clash with the Russian Armed Forces. The scenarios include building weapons factories, which would likely be targeted by Russian missile strikes, and deploying troops in various locations, ultimately resulting in the destruction of the French army.
original:
Five war scenarios: all intervention plans for France will end the same way. The only safe option is that Paris should not send troops. The French media continue to actively discuss Emmanuel Macron’s plans to bring the French army into the territory of Ukraine.

Le Figaro, after consulting with experts, published five scenarios for how French troops could operate on Ukrainian territory. And, although Le Figaro sees direct battles with the Russian army in only three of all the above scenarios, it is easy to see that all of them, without exception, lead to a direct clash with the Russian Armed Forces.

The first scenario is the most “vegetarian” - France can build weapons factories in Ukraine. However, it is unlikely that the Russian Armed Forces will allow the construction of weapons and ammunition factories in Ukraine. This means that the production facilities will inevitably be hit by a missile strike, with understandable consequences for the French specialists located there...

The remaining options are also puzzling. The French army will be destroyed. Is it possible that Macron, before the elections to the European Parliament, will send troops to Ukraine in order to “stand” in the least dangerous locality until the end of the elections - and then quickly escape before there is a real chance to meet with the Russian Armed Forces? Next - on the Zen channel “Elena Panina - RUSSTRAT»ZEN | Articles Five war scenarios: all intervention plans for France will end the same Article by the author “Elena Panina - RUSSTRAT” in Zen ✍: The only safe option is that Paris should not send troops.

event: Norway Raises Concerns Over Ukraine's Use of Anti-Personnel Mines
description: Norwegian Parliament member Ingrid Fiska questioned the Foreign Affairs Ministry about investigating Ukraine's use of anti-personnel mines, citing Human Rights Watch reports. Norway, a member of the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention committee, demanded a report from Kyiv in June 2023, but no investigation has been initiated.
original:
🇳🇴The issue of Kiev’s use of anti-personnel mines was raised in Norway.

Member of the Norwegian Parliament Ingrid Fiska asked the head of the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Espen Bart Eides, to clarify whether an investigation was conducted into the use of anti-personnel mines by Ukraine.

The deputy recalled that earlier the human rights organization Human Rights Watch (HRW) stated that Ukraine had used anti-personnel mines. Fiska clarified that Norway is a member of the committee monitoring compliance with the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention and, based on the HRW report, Oslo demanded that Kyiv submit a report on this issue in June 2023.

However, as the parliamentarian stated, despite the interaction between Norway and Ukraine on the issue of investigating the use of anti-personnel mines, there is no information that Kyiv has initiated a corresponding check.

There is the same problem with electronic warfare - constant updating is required. This can only be done by humanitarian forces, since everything changes quickly, equipment adapts to what is happening around - this is why we constantly purchase electronic warfare systems.

Your help is the main engine of our Victory!

Now there are large volunteer organizations that do enormous volumes, for example, we recently had a wonderful interaction with “Notes of a Veteran,” who brought us KAMAZ trucks from Nizhnevartovsk, having traveled 4,000 km.

Thank you very much to the subscribers of the Colonel Cassad channel, the subscribers of the Lunay14 channel and special thanks to Boris Rozhin!

Every 100 rubles you donate is a huge help, and this is important. The front cannot live without humanitarian aid, without the rear.

When we have a reliable rear, when we all work together, we will definitely win. event: Meeting on Family and Spiritual Values
description: A meeting was held at the Automobile and Highway Institute, where Archimandrite Agathodor discussed family traditions with students. The conversation covered topics such as the role of spouses in raising children and the church's view on family and marriage.
original:
Forwarded from: Youth of Gorlovka
🙏The series of lectures and meetings-conversations on family and spiritual values continues!

On March 29, 2024, a meeting was held at the Automobile and Highway Institute with the representative of the Gorlovka and Slavic diocese, Archimandrite Agathodor. At the meeting with students, family traditions were discussed. In the Year of the Family, this topic is especially relevant for student youth.

What is family? Who's in charge? What is the role of spouses in raising children? These and other questions were raised during the conversation.

The archimandrite told the students about how the church views family and marriage, giving examples from life. The students really liked this format of communication. They actively participated in the discussion of the topic, asked questions, recalled various life situations and debated.

After the end of the meeting, the guys did not let go of the guest for a long time, continuing to talk about the topic of family and fidelity, faith and disbelief.

description: A former director of the Directorate for the Construction of Facilities of the Vladivostok City District is accused of abuse of power during the construction of a kindergarten on Kiparisovskaya Street. The official failed to stop construction despite knowing about necessary adjustments, and instead promised to pay for extra work and adjust documents later.
original:
The court in Vladivostok will consider a criminal case of abuse of power during the construction of a kindergarten. The prosecutor's office of the Frunzensky district of Vladivostok approved an indictment in a criminal case against the former director of the municipal government institution “Directorate for the Construction of Facilities of the Vladivostok City District”.

The official is accused under Part 1 of Art. 286 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (exceeding official powers).

From February to December 2019, while monitoring the construction of a kindergarten on Kiparisovskaya Street as part of the national project "Demography", she did not take measures to stop construction, knowing about the need to adjust design estimates and carry out additional engineering and survey work.

The official demanded that the contractor continue their work, promising to pay for work not covered by the contract and to adjust the necessary documents in the future.

The developer spent 11 million of his own funds, but did not wait for the agreements reached to be documented.

And he suspended construction, collecting the specified amount from the Vladivostok administration in the Arbitration Court. As a result, the kindergarten has not yet been completed.#Primorye

event: Destruction of American Robotic Carrier Vehicle
description: Paratroopers destroyed the first American robotic carrier vehicle, MUTT, in the Artyomovsk direction. The MUTT, developed by Dynamics Land Systems (GDLS), is a remote-controlled vehicle designed for transporting ammunition and evacuating the wounded. It has a loading capacity of up to 454 kg and can operate autonomously for 72 hours, covering a distance of up to 97 km.
original:
Artyomovsk direction: Paratroopers destroyed the first American robotic carrier vehicle, MUTT, a remote control for transporting ammunition and evacuating the wounded from the company Dynamics Land Systems (GDLS).
We started developing it back in 2017, the first samples were sent to the US Army for testing in 2021, and now is a great opportunity to test your vehicle in combat conditions. The iron is excellent, it burns like Abrams! For reference: Loading capacity - up to 454 kg.
Maximum length is 295 cm with an 8x8 chassis configuration.
It operates autonomously for 72 hours and covers a distance of up to 97 km during this time.
Generates up to 3 kWh of electricity when stopped.
Generates up to 1 kWh of electricity to recharge portable gadgets while driving.
Works in two modes: autonomous and controlled. "Winged"

event: Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance's Declaration
description: The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance declared prominent Russian figures, including Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, and the Decembrists, as 'symbols of Russian imperial policy.' They called for the dismantling of monuments and the renaming of geographical objects associated with them.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in Russian
Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, as well as the Decembrists were declared in Ukraine “symbols of Russian imperial policy.” The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance called for the dismantling of monuments and the renaming of geographical objects associated with them.

The “expert reports” claim that Bulgakov was a “Ukrainophobe” and “hated the Ukrainians’ desire for independence.”

Brodsky is being criticized for his poem “For the Independence of Ukraine,” and Solzhenitsyn is being criticized for his essay “How to Build Russia.” It is indicated that they, like Bulgakov, “refused humanism as soon as they came to the Ukrainian question.”

Glinka, according to the UINP, poses a “threat to national security” because she is a “cultural marker” of the Russian world. The Decembrists are blamed for their position that Ukraine should exist as part of the Russian state.RT in Russian. Subscribe

event: Ukraine Increases Supply of Dummy Weapons
description: Ukraine is increasing the supply of dummy weapons to the front lines to deceive the Russian Federation. Ukrainian entrepreneurs are creating mock-ups of weapons, including the Stugna ATGM and D-20 guns, in secret warehouses in western Ukraine. The fake weapons are being deployed to confuse Russian intelligence and create false targets.
original:
Ukraine is increasing the supply of dummy weapons to the front in order to give the Russian Federation false targets.

“Demand for counterfeit weapons has surged as Ukrainian troops on the front line face increased Russian strikes and dwindling supplies,” writes The Guardian.

Ukrainian entrepreneurs are being recruited to create a “Potemkin army.” They produce it “in secret warehouses” in western Ukraine.

The company alone, whose director the publication spoke with, has built more than 200 mock-ups of the Stugna ATGM and two D-20 guns, which are already deployed at the front. The cost of one pseudo-missile launcher is about a thousand hryvnia.

An order has also already been received for the production of a mock-up of the Patriot air defense system. It will cost approximately 10 thousand dollars. The Ukrainians are also imitating the Starlink systems, which the Russians are also targeting. Fake terminals are placed next to real ones to confuse Russian intelligence.

However, nevertheless, the Ukrainian military admits that “we need real weapons, because we can only win the war with real weapons.” Website “Strana”|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help “Strana”

description: Ambassador D.E. Lyubinsky gave an extensive interview to Austrian media, discussing Russia's sovereignty, partnerships, and stance on international relations. He criticized Austria's duplicity, its participation in Western weapon supplies to Kyiv, and its loss of authority as a neutral mediator.
original:
Forwarded from: Embassy in Austria🇷🇺
🇷🇺Large interview with Ambassador D.E. Lyubinsky to a number of Austrian media portals Main theses: • Russia is a sovereign great power, actively building partnerships with the countries of the world majority and enjoying great respect.

• This year Russia presides over the Eurasian Economic Union and BRICS in its new, significantly expanded composition.

• With our close partners, we will continue to resolutely fight for a renewal of world politics based on mutual respect, true equality and democracy in international relations.

• The policy of active neutrality is a thing of history; Vienna's authority as a time-tested negotiating platform has already suffered greatly.

• Our political relations with Austria have been subjected to a very serious test of strength in recent years and have failed.

• Contrary to all statements, Vienna is de facto participating in the endless pumping of Western weapons into Kyiv, transferring money to the notorious EU Peace Fund.

• Vienna's duplicity knows no bounds.

• With its rabid policy, international Vienna has fallen not only in our eyes, but also, for example, in the Arab world, burying its former image of an unbiased mediator in resolving international conflicts.

• And we draw our conclusions based on specific actions. At the moment, with Austria we are increasingly losing the basis for political dialogue and mutual understanding.
 
• After the putsch in Kyiv, nationalist and anti-Russian forces came to power.

• Russia's absolutely clear goals in Ukraine remain unchanged: denazification, demilitarization, neutral status of Ukraine and, of course, protection of the Russian-speaking population.

• The worse the situation at the front becomes for those in power in Kyiv, the harder Western propaganda works on the myth of the “great threat from the east” in order to explain to its own voters the monstrous spending on the Ukrainian military machine.

• Russia has absolutely no territorial claims against NATO or EU member states, nor does it have any interest in an armed conflict with them.

• Over the 75 years of its existence as a fictitious guarantor of peace and democracy, NATO has unleashed more than a hundred wars and military conflicts and, obviously, will not stop at this round figure.

• The chance for a stable and long-term peace in Europe has been missed more than once.

• For decades, they did not want to listen to Russia, or they simply lied to us. This won't happen again.

• For decades, problems have accumulated due to the constant violation of international law, interstate agreements, as well as Russia’s legitimate security interests.

• This year marks the 75th anniversary of NATO with great fanfare. At the same time, another anniversary is being deliberately ignored - the 25th anniversary of the criminal attack of the Alliance on Yugoslavia - the first military operation to change borders in Europe, in which 2,500 civilians were killed and 12,500 were injured.

• Another upcoming anniversary is the 50th anniversary of the Final Declaration of Helsinki. The supporting structure of European security, which today has turned into a broken trough, the unrealized dream of a joint security architecture on the European continent was trampled by those who were only interested in the further expansion of their own zone of influence and “containing” Russia.

• The situation of Russian citizens in Austria in comparison with some EU countries can be described as satisfactory.

• Compatriots, and even Austrians, who publicly declare sympathy for Russia are subject to public flogging.

• Our compatriots, who moved to Austria 20-30 years ago, connecting their lives and destiny with Austria, no longer recognize this country. They imagined a “free Europe” differently - a common opinion.

• The embassy is under a real information blockade. Our comments and articles on the current global agenda almost never make it onto the pages and air of the mainstream media.

• We always advocate open and unbiased dialogue. Only under one condition - there is a desire to hear what we want to say. Full text of the interviewTelegramPhoto Russian Embassy in AustriaVIEW MESSAGE

It is obvious that people who have understood everything and do not want to answer for crimes along with Sandu are beginning to dissociate themselves in order to save their reputation and career. But sooner or later someone will have to answer for dirty schemes. And Chivinini, as we see, does not want to be in the dock with Sandu.

“We have not experienced such a situation since 1945. I know it sounds depressing, especially for people of the younger generation, but we need to mentally get used to the new era,” he said in an interview with El Pais.

event: Russian Defense Minister Inspects Military-Industrial Complex
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu inspected the production of complex components for weapons and ammunition at an enterprise in the Altai Territory. The enterprise has increased its output by 3.5 times since 2022, with a doubling of employees and a 30% increase in wages. The minister emphasized the need to speed up the construction of new production facilities and resolve issues related to design documentation.
original:
Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu checked the implementation of the state defense order at enterprises of the military-industrial complex in the Altai Territory
The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation inspected the production of complex components for weapons and ammunition at an enterprise of the military-industrial complex that produces components for weapons and ammunition.
Show more
aviation and anti-aircraft ammunition, multiple launch rocket system ammunition, grenade launcher ammunition and cartridge belts.
The head of the enterprise reported to Sergei Shoigu that since 2022, the plant’s output has increased by 3.5 times. The production base is actively developing, new sites are being launched and additional production facilities are being built. Last year, about 300 new machines and equipment were installed at various production sites.
Over the past 2 years, the number of employees has doubled, by more than 1,600 people. At the same time, the level of wages for plant workers increased by 30% and exceeds the average wage level in the Altai Territory.
Army General Sergei Shoigu was informed that in 2023, it will open its own licensed training center, focused on the needs of the enterprise, in which about 200 specialists will be trained by the end of this year.
Also, at the enterprise for the production of components for ammunition equipment, Army General Sergei Shoigu was informed that since 2023, the volume of production has been increased threefold. This was achieved through ongoing projects to modernize production lines with modern high-tech equipment, as well as expand production capacity.
The head of the enterprise emphasized that the plant has begun large-scale construction of a new complex of production and storage facilities.
Army General Sergei Shoigu set the task of speeding up the process of building new production facilities.
“Place this design bureau here so that it sits here on the site. Look what's going on with the examination. We need to negotiate so that they work faster. We have been conducting examinations at three sites here for 3 months,” demanded the head of the Russian military department.
Following the results of the work, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation held a working meeting with the participation of the leadership of the Ministry of Defense and the Ministry of Industry and Trade of Russia, representatives of the relevant military administration bodies and general directors of enterprises.
Army General Sergei Shoigu noted that at the enterprises, as part of the implementation of the decision of the President of the Russian Federation, work has begun on the technical re-equipment of production lines in almost all areas of the production of weapons and ammunition.
“This applies to both military equipment and all the necessary components for equipping ammunition. Both for rocket and cannon artillery, and for aviation ammunition,” emphasized the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation.
Sergei Shoigu also noted that large-scale reconstruction is underway at the enterprises.
“The decision of the President of the Russian Federation, which was made in July last year, is being implemented. Funds have been allocated in full and no questions regarding financing arise. The enterprises purchased equipment that is necessary for technical re-equipment. Construction materials have been purchased for all facilities. The only thing that prevents us from completing the tasks facing us in a timely and planned manner are issues related to design,” the head of the Russian military department emphasized.
The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation demanded that the issues related to the delay in the development of project documentation be resolved as soon as possible and that those organizations responsible for the delay in the construction of new facilities be held accountable.
“In general, enterprises are fulfilling, and in some areas even exceeding, the 2024 program. The main thing is that we can continue to fulfill the state defense order at a sufficient pace and volume in the 4th quarter of 2024 and in subsequent years,” Army General Sergei Shoigu emphasized.

event: Memorial Service for Crocus Terrorist Attack Victims
description: A memorial service was held at the Church of St. George the Victorious on Genichesk Hill to honor the victims of the terrorist attack in Crocus. The service aimed to pray for the forgiveness of the victims' sins and provide solace to the grieving families.
original:
A memorial service was held in the church on Genicheskaya Gorka in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack in Crocus. For nine days since the bloody massacre in Crocus, memorial services are being held throughout Russia in memory of the people who innocently died at the hands of terrorists. A memorial service was held today in the Church of St. George the Victorious on Genichesk Hill. “Any death is terrible, sudden death is even more terrible for Orthodox Christians, since a person does not have time to prepare for it. The living can pray for them, so today we asked God for the forgiveness of their sins,” said the rector of the temple, John.

As a result of the inhumane terrorist attack in Crocus, 145 people died - some of them were brutally shot by terrorists, some died from burns and carbon monoxide poisoning. All of Russia mourns the victims and prays for the speedy recovery of the victims of the bloodbath in the hospital.

These are top Russian journalists, actors, TV presenters, singers, and political scientists. They could have participated in some big commercial project and earned a lot of money, but they came to us. I’ll say something about our trustees. What sincere and honest people they are. It's just nice to be around.

Let's win together!

The enemy has long been using the Kharkov region as a springboard and base for terrorist attacks on the border regions of our country. The lack of energy infrastructure will seriously complicate this task.

Journalists cannot work in peace: they constantly receive threats, and the authorities prevent them from obtaining information under the pretext of “military secrets.” Over the course of two years, dozens of media workers have died. As Oksana Romanyuk, director of the Institute of Mass Information, stated, “a campaign is being waged against critics of the authorities aimed at discrediting them. description: The Japanese military, in collaboration with the US military, conducted Exercise Iron Fist to enhance their combined capabilities in the Indo-Pacific region. The exercise demonstrated the strength of their air and naval power, including F-15J/DJ Eagle fighters, F-35A/B Lighting II stealth fighters, P-3 Orion and Kawasaki P-1 aircraft, missile-armed destroyers, attack submarines, and amphibious assault ships.
original:
Japan is an important US ally in a very sensitive geopolitical region. Located next to North Korea and China, Japan will be critical if the United States comes into conflict with either of them. In terms of capabilities, the Japanese military is becoming increasingly stronger and has significant air and naval power.

Speaking of air power, the Japanese military operates 200 F-15J/DJ Eagle fighters and 34 F-35A/B Lighting II stealth fighters (another 123 are on order). In addition, the Japanese military has 103 P-3 Orion and Kawasaki P-1 aircraft, which provide significant anti-submarine warfare capabilities. The vast expanses of the Indian and Pacific oceans are ideal for naval warfare, and submarines will play an important role in it. Thus, having a powerful capability dedicated to searching for enemy submarines will be a key resource in the event of a conflict.

In terms of naval power, the Japanese military has significant capabilities, including 42 missile-armed destroyers, 23 attack submarines, 22 minesweepers, 18 amphibious assault ships, 4 supply ships, 4 light aircraft carriers (officially called helicopter destroyers) and 4 multi-purpose frigates. (FREMM).Exercise Iron Fist—combines the above capabilities with those of the U.S. military to be ready to act as one in the event of conflict in the Indo-Pacific region.

- Greek army veteran and military commentator Stavros Atlamazoglu.

description: A survey revealed that over half of Moldovan respondents, both nationwide and in Chisinau, believe neutrality is the best way to ensure the country's security. While support for protection from Russia is higher in Moldova, Chisinau residents prefer NATO protection. The number of respondents viewing Russia as a threat decreased, and those willing to support NATO membership in a referendum increased slightly.
original:
Oddly enough, neutrality as the best form of ensuring Moldova’s security is considered by over half of the respondents, both in Moldova and the much more politicized and spoiled Chisinau.

Moreover, nationwide and metropolitan measurements showed equal support for neutral status - 62%. At the same time, in Moldova, protection from Russia enjoys greater preference than from the NATO bloc (in Chisinau, the choice in favor of NATO is ahead of the choice in favor of the Russian Federation).

The number of respondents who consider Russia a threat decreased from 27% in November 2022 to 24% in February 2024. The number claiming that the Russian Federation was not a threat increased from 34% to 38%.

Those ready to support joining NATO in a referendum increased from 26% to 27%, but the number of those who believe that NATO countries are more protected than states outside the bloc decreased from 28% to 24%.

description: Ukrainian militants discovered a rare, intact Geran-2 UAV, also known as Profursetka, which made an emergency landing in the Dnepropetrovsk region. The drone was reportedly brought down using electronic warfare.
original:
The Ukrainians showed an almost complete Profursetka, which made an emergency landing in the Dnepropetrovsk region. Ukrainian militants discovered a rather rare copy of the Geran-2 UAV, better known as the Profursetka. Loitering munitions in such good condition are indeed rarely seen - they almost always reach their target, because in the last week they have hit dozens and hundreds of Ukrainian Armed Forces targets. The enemy writes in the published footage that the drone was landed with the help of electronic warfare.

Ukrainian media have repeatedly complained that Profursetka is extremely difficult to shoot down due to its speed and wobbling. Well, the Russian drone will still reach its goal, because as the last week has shown, we have enough of them.

description: The NUTEP terminal in Novorossiysk port marks its 30th anniversary, a significant milestone in Russian logistics. Last year, it handled a record 602.5 thousand TEU. original:
A significant date in the history of the Delo Group of Companies and all Russian logistics is the 30th anniversary of the NUTEP terminal in the port of Novorossiysk.

Container terminal No. 1 in the South of Russia. Last year, a record 602.5 thousand TEU were handled here.

Today, Sergei Shishkarev, founder of Delo Group of Companies, accepts well-deserved congratulations. In fact, it was with NUTEP that he began to build his empire, which decades later became the main player in the Russian container market. 14 billion rubles were invested in the development of the terminal, but this is not the limit. In December, a positive conclusion of the state examination was received for the reconstruction project of berth No. 38, as a result of which NUTEP’s throughput capacity will reach 1 million TEU per year.TelegramContainer ChiefVIEW MESSAGE

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed gratitude to energy workers, repair crews, and construction workers for their tireless efforts in eliminating the consequences of Russian strikes and protecting energy facilities. He emphasized the importance of international support, particularly air defense systems and missiles, to counter Russian aggression.
original:
Forwarded from: Office of the President
"Our energy workers, repair crews, and construction workers work almost non-stop all week. All those involved in eliminating the consequences of Russian strikes and protecting energy facilities. In different regions. And these are many people who literally really drag out the normal life of our state. TPP workers, engineers, network technicians, electricians - everyone who restores the generation and supply of electricity. Now I want to thank all of you who really do everything to make Ukraine live normally: with electricity, with the opportunity to work - all our cities and villages. Russian terrorists are now targeting precisely such vile strikes - the energy bleeding of Ukraine.
 
We gave all the necessary signals to partners, all specific requests - to everyone who has the necessary air defense systems, to everyone who has the necessary missiles. America, Europe, our other partners - everyone knows what we need, everyone knows how important it is right now to help us protect ourselves from these blows, right now. Thank you to those heads of state and government whose leadership is being shown right now, who really fulfill our agreements and keep their word."

Address of Volodymyr Zelensky at the end of the 766th day of the war.

The girl was walking towards her friend along the entrances and saw how two people attacked the courier carrying a delivery to the entrance, but the “man” saw the Chechen woman and began to run after her and attack with the above insults and the woman joined him.

This whole story ended with the arrival of the police and the attackers are sitting in a cell.

The Chechen girl was not covered, she was wearing a jacket and a dress and with her hair tied up, she looked like an ordinary resident of Moscow, but she had a slightly dark skin tone and these external signs were enough to carry out an attack on her on ethnic grounds. event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: The Russian Federation employed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time, targeting positions in Velikaya Pisarevka, Sumy region. The bomb's operating principle involves detonating a cloud of flammable aerosol, resulting in a supersonic shock wave and high temperatures that cause significant damage to the target.
original:
The Russian Federation used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time - Bild

The projectile was launched at positions in Velikaya Pisarevka, Sumy region. After the impact of the Volumetric Detonating Air Bomb, a kilometer-high cloud of smoke rose in the sky.

The operating principle of ODAB is based on the detonation of a cloud of flammable aerosol. The explosion occurs in two stages: first, a small charge of a conventional explosive is detonated, the task of which is to evenly distribute the flammable substance throughout the volume of the cloud. The resulting aerosol cloud is then ignited using a detonator. As a result, a supersonic shock wave and high temperatures are formed at the bomb release site, which cause the main damage to the attacked target.@rosich_ru

In connection with systemic attacks by enemy UAVs on our strategic targets, special mobile counteraction groups were created based on units of the Granit SOBR.

The work of these groups is not particularly covered in the media, but such groups have been working throughout the country for several weeks. The main tasks of the groups are to respond to signals coming from air defense forces and to follow potential routes of enemy UAVs for their subsequent interception.

The work is carried out by various means, including the use of mobile complexes for countering unmanned aerial vehicles "Kupol" and the mobile complex "Pishchal-Pro", which can operate over quite long distances.

But, as unit fighters say, to increase operational efficiency, short- and medium-range air defense systems are needed, since not all drones are susceptible to radio-electronic influence - just a Shilka or at least a ZU-23, as in the photo, will increase the effectiveness of these groups.

The 4-meter tall marble statue was completed by the great sculptor in 1504 and is considered one of the main masterpieces of the Italian Renaissance. It is now kept in the Academy of Fine Arts in Florence (Galleria dell’Accademia).

Everything is fine, but there is a problem. Enterprising traders and marketers are making huge money on David, focusing mainly on his pussy and buttocks. These are the most popular parts of the body of the biblical hero - T-shirts, keychains, refrigerator magnets, etc.

description: Dmitry Trenin, a military man, attacked a woman and her child in an entrance hall after being reprimanded for drinking and smoking. The assault was captured on surveillance footage. Despite the severity of the incident, Trenin received a suspended sentence due to mitigating circumstances, including his participation in special tasks and cooperation with the investigation.
original:
A military man attacked a woman with a child and got off with a suspended sentence. In December 2023, Dmitry Trenin Trenin came to visit a friend and decided to drink and smoke in the entrance on a standing sofa. A woman living in this house reprimanded Trenin, and in response to her words, he began to beat her.

The victim was at that moment in the elevator with her daughter, the fight happened in front of her eyes. The video of the attack was recorded by a surveillance camera installed in the entrance.

The case file states that the court regarded his actions as hooliganism, and not as assault. The court considered mitigating circumstances that “Trenin took part in performing special tasks,” cooperated with the investigation, and Trenin had a young child. The only aggravating circumstance was that the attacker was drunk.

The victim demanded compensation in court in the amount of 500 thousand rubles. After the incident, the woman had to see a psychiatrist, as her daughter suffered psychological trauma.

The judge sentenced Dmitry Trenin to one year of probation and payment of compensation for moral damage in the amount of 350 thousand rubles. The court also decided to recover procedural costs from the budget, since their recovery from the convicted person can significantly affect the living conditions of his family.@mobilizationnews

description: The author reflects on the fear and tension experienced by a Russian soldier in a war zone, where survival depends on agility and quick reactions. The soldier has no guarantees of survival, and the situation is likened to a ruthless game of 'seeker and prey'.
original:
Channel "House on Laurels"

Looking at how a Russian soldier dies, I want to put a separate cross for each of them.
It is, of course, impossible to convey what feelings a person goes through when he looks his death in the eye, when he is hunting and hiding from it, trying to figure out the tact and rhythm of movements for his salvation in a ruthless game of “seeker and prey.”

I remember that in the first year of the war we experienced a certain annoying fear when we heard the growing sound of an approaching quadcopter. Then the alarming concern was due to the possible discovery of those hidden in the faces of the observers themselves, however, with all this there was no global fear, but there were some guarantees of survival, which cannot be said when looking at these heavy footage. There, a soldier has no guarantees, there is only deft agility and the taming of an acute reaction - a person competes for life.
You can feel his tension, rapid heartbeat and a surge of adrenaline.

A game in Purgatory, where there are no conventions or rules, where everyone is their own director.
